Description: Papyrus fragment bearing four lines of Coptic text written against the fibres (verso). Photographed with EA 75329, 75328, 75327.
Curator's comments: Written by a monk of a monastery of Apa Apollo for which the acquisition details suggest a Hermopolite context.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 138, pl.47)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86613) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86613)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
